p: Olive oil, the main fat in the Mediterranean diet, has long been considered to be healthy and its influence on the intestinal microbiota has recently been studied [ 11, 12, 25]. Moreover, correlations between the percentage of specific bacterial taxa and physiological variables related to the metabolic syndrome [ 12, 26] have been reported. Considering the dissimilar composition of the unsaponifiable fraction of different olive oils, a comparison between virgin and refined olive oil can help us to understand the responsibility of polyphenols and other minority components on the beneficial effects of olive oil and the importance of intestinal microbiota on them.
